intro: Memecylon laurinum, commonly known as the white memecylon, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other economically important trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters. It produces small, round fruits that are typically dispersed by wind or animals. Memecylon laurinum is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
